segment.source: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components
segment.target: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components

segment.source: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components
segment.target: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components

segment.source: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components
segment.target: How to Uninstall the MED-V Components

segment.source: Under certain circumstances, you might want to uninstall all or part of the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 components from your enterprise.
segment.target: Under certain circumstances, you might want to uninstall all or part of the Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 components from your enterprise.

segment.source: For example, you have resolved all application operating system compatibility issues, or you want to deploy a different MED-V workspace in your enterprise.
segment.target: For example, you have resolved all application operating system compatibility issues, or you want to deploy a different MED-V workspace in your enterprise.

segment.source: Typically, you can configure your electronic software distribution (ESD) system to uninstall the MED-V components by using a Windows-based Installer.
segment.target: Typically, you can configure your electronic software distribution (ESD) system to uninstall the MED-V components by using a Windows-based Installer.

segment.source: Alternately, you can uninstall all or some MED-V components manually.
segment.target: Alternately, you can uninstall all or some MED-V components manually.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Before you can uninstall the MED-V Host Agent, you must first uninstall any installed MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Before you can uninstall the MED-V Host Agent, you must first uninstall any installed MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to uninstall the MED-V components from your enterprise.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to uninstall the MED-V components from your enterprise.

segment.source: To uninstall MED-V using an electronic software distribution System
segment.target: To uninstall MED-V using an electronic software distribution System

segment.source: Use your ESD system to distribute a script that invokes the uninstall.exe executable program for every MED-V workspace that you want to uninstall.
segment.target: Use your ESD system to distribute a script that invokes the uninstall.exe executable program for every MED-V workspace that you want to uninstall.

segment.source: The file is located at C:ProgramDataMicrosoftMedvWorkspace.
segment.target: The file is located at C:ProgramDataMicrosoftMedvWorkspace.

segment.source: You can set a flag to run the uninstall executable program silently so that end users are unaware of the uninstallation.
segment.target: You can set a flag to run the uninstall executable program silently so that end users are unaware of the uninstallation.

segment.source: Create a package to distribute the MED-V Host Agent installation file to each computer on which a MED-V workspace was uninstalled.
segment.target: Create a package to distribute the MED-V Host Agent installation file to each computer on which a MED-V workspace was uninstalled.

segment.source: Configure the package to run the uninstallation in silent mode.
segment.target: Configure the package to run the uninstallation in silent mode.

segment.source: The ESD client recognizes when the new packages are available and starts to uninstall the packages per the definition and requirements.
segment.target: The ESD client recognizes when the new packages are available and starts to uninstall the packages per the definition and requirements.

segment.source: To manually uninstall a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To manually uninstall a MED-V workspace

segment.source: On the host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.
segment.target: On the host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.

segment.source: In the Programs and Features window, select the MED-V workspace that you want to remove, and then click Uninstall.
segment.target: In the Programs and Features window, select the MED-V workspace that you want to remove, and then click Uninstall.

segment.source: (The MED-V workspace is named "MED-V Workspace - workspacename").
segment.target: (The MED-V workspace is named "MED-V Workspace - workspacename").

segment.source: The workspacenameSetup Wizard opens.
segment.target: The workspacenameSetup Wizard opens.

segment.source: On the Setup Wizard, click Next, and then click Remove.
segment.target: On the Setup Wizard, click Next, and then click Remove.

segment.source: If you prefer, select the check box to delete the master VHD disk and differencing disks created by MED-V.
segment.target: If you prefer, select the check box to delete the master VHD disk and differencing disks created by MED-V.

segment.source: This is not required, but frees disk space after the uninstallation finishes.
segment.target: This is not required, but frees disk space after the uninstallation finishes.

segment.source: Click Remove.
segment.target: Click Remove.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If MED-V is currently running, a dialog box appears and prompts you whether you want to shut it down.
segment.target: If MED-V is currently running, a dialog box appears and prompts you whether you want to shut it down.

segment.source: Click Yes to continue with the uninstallation.
segment.target: Click Yes to continue with the uninstallation.

segment.source: Click No to cancel the uninstallation.
segment.target: Click No to cancel the uninstallation.

segment.source: Alternately, you can remove a MED-V workspace by running the file, typically located at C:ProgramDataMicrosoftMedvWorkspace.
segment.target: Alternately, you can remove a MED-V workspace by running the file, typically located at C:ProgramDataMicrosoftMedvWorkspace.

segment.source: To manually uninstall the MED-V Host Agent
segment.target: To manually uninstall the MED-V Host Agent

segment.source: On the Windows 7 host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.
segment.target: On the Windows 7 host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.

segment.source: In the Programs and Features window, select MED-V Host Agent, and then click Uninstall.
segment.target: In the Programs and Features window, select MED-V Host Agent, and then click Uninstall.

segment.source: The Windows Installer removes the MED-V Host Agent.
segment.target: The Windows Installer removes the MED-V Host Agent.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you try to uninstall the MED-V Host Agent before you uninstall the MED-V workspace, a dialog box appears that states that you must first uninstall the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: If you try to uninstall the MED-V Host Agent before you uninstall the MED-V workspace, a dialog box appears that states that you must first uninstall the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Click OK to continue.
segment.target: Click OK to continue.

segment.source: To manually uninstall the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: To manually uninstall the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: On the host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.
segment.target: On the host computer, click Start, click Control Panel, and then click Programs and Features.

segment.source: In the Programs and Features window, select MED-V Workspace Packager, and then click Uninstall.
segment.target: In the Programs and Features window, select MED-V Workspace Packager, and then click Uninstall.

segment.source: The Windows Installer removes the MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: The Windows Installer removes the MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can uninstall the MED-V Workspace Packager at any time without affecting any deployed MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: You can uninstall the MED-V Workspace Packager at any time without affecting any deployed MED-V workspaces.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Deploy the MED-V Components
